StreamPtr src

Detailed Description

A stream that filters another stream with no changes. Intended as a base class for other filters.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

const void* Mangle::Stream::PureFilter::getPtr ( size_t  size  )  [inline, virtual]

Get a pointer to a memory region of 'size' bytes from the current position. Unlike the two other getPtr variants, this will advance the position past the returned area.

Reimplemented from Mangle::Stream::Stream.

const void* Mangle::Stream::PureFilter::getPtr (  )  [inline, virtual]

Return a pointer to the entire stream. This function (and the other getPtr() variants below) should only be implemented for memory-based streams where using them would be an optimization.

Reimplemented from Mangle::Stream::Stream.

size_t Mangle::Stream::PureFilter::read ( void *  buf,
size_t  count 
) [inline, virtual]

Read a given number of bytes from the stream. Returns the actual number read. If the return value is less than count, then the stream is empty or an error occured. Only required for readable streams.

Reimplemented from Mangle::Stream::Stream.

void Mangle::Stream::PureFilter::seek ( size_t  pos  )  [inline, virtual]

Seek to an absolute position in this stream. Not all streams are seekable.

Reimplemented from Mangle::Stream::Stream.

size_t Mangle::Stream::PureFilter::size (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Return the total size of the stream. For streams hasSize is false, size() should fail in some way, since it is an error to call it in those cases.

Reimplemented from Mangle::Stream::Stream.

size_t Mangle::Stream::PureFilter::tell (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Get the current position in the stream. Non-seekable streams are not required to keep track of this.

Reimplemented from Mangle::Stream::Stream.

size_t Mangle::Stream::PureFilter::write ( const void *  buf,
size_t  count 
) [inline, virtual]

Write a given number of bytes from the stream. Semantics is similar to read(). Only valid if isWritable is true.

The returned value is the number of bytes written. However in most cases, unlike for read(), a write-count less than requested usually indicates an error. The implementation should throw such errors as exceptions rather than expect the caller to handle them.

Since most implementations do NOT support writing we default to an assert(0) here.

Reimplemented from Mangle::Stream::Stream.
